website_summaries.verdict: The combination of a great entry-level price point and secure design makes this model worthy of consideration for short term or post-surgical use.
pros: Rim of seat fits securely inside round bowls
Raised height is ideal for post-surgery needs
Seamless construction with no sharp edges
cons: Defecation may be a challenge with narrow configuration

customer_reviews.title: Did the designer ever try to use this thing?
customer_reviews.text: This seat is not shaped to accommodate a normally sized or normally shaped buttocks. It pushes the cheeks together making it hard to move your bowels. It is a serious design defect. It is also not shaped to fit into an elongated commode. They need to go back to the drawing board on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Nursine S. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: This seat is great. I have rheumatoid arthritis and my knees are ...
customer_reviews.text: This seat is great. I have rheumatoid arthritis and my knees are pretty bad. It fits securely, doesn't wobble and makes my life so much easier. The best part is, when I have company I can just hide it in the shower. Note: It fits on the bowl, not on the seat. Unfortunately the toilet lid cannot be lowered while in use. Comfortable and easy to clean. I am only 53 and am not ready to install a permanent riser, so this is perfect for me. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Post Hip Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this raised toilet seat as an assist after hip replacement. This product was easy to install (per my husband it just snapped on). I was worried about the snapping on and security, but there's no slipping and its very secure. I've been using it for 3 weeks and no adjustments have needed to be made. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great for arthritis!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in both knees and trouble sitting down and standing back up. This seat makes the toilet the perfect height. It is also easy to pop on and remove, lightweight, and simple to clean. No more knee strain. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Useful and Practical
customer_reviews.text: If you have had hip or TKR surgery, you know certain functions become difficult to manage. Most insurance companies send you home with a commode seat chair with insert and handles. Fine if you have the fanny of a 14 year old anorexic but most candidates for hip and knee replacement are older and tend to weigh a bit more than 80 pounds and have an ample caboose. This inset will make everyone just a bit happier. The added height will certainly be appreciated by those recovering from knee surgery as it's just enough to allow the legs do their job: lift you up.
customer_reviews.author: Hrothgar

customer_reviews.title: Initially I was very happy with this raised toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was very happy with this raised toilet seat. It fit well, was clean, and a great help to my elderly mother. I was advised by an occupational therapist not to buy a seat of this type for safety issues. So I checked this one out carefully. It fit beautifully and securely. Now, two months later, it is not safe at all! For some reason that I cannot determine it slides around....very dangerous! I can only assume that whatever part provided the tight and stable grip must have stretched or something... And, of course, it is too late for a return. Waste of a senior's limited income!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stretchy hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a review when I first got this. I was very happy with the product. Now, several months later, I am not very happy. Another reviewer had commented that the inside plastic stretches and the seat does not fit securely. It slides around and pops up, about causing a person to literally fall off the seat! If anyone can tell me how to fix it, I would be happy to try that. Meanwhile, I have to purchase another one. If it happens again, I will not purchase another one, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Shadal

customer_reviews.title: Good solution
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I flipped up both the toilet seat and lid, dropped this raised seat into place, and I was ready to go. It fits fine. If you use your hands to TRY to make it wobble, it will. A little. But using it for a week, it doesn't seem dangerous, and I haven't encountered any of the problems mentioned in 1-star reviews. I have a herniated disc and the physical therapist recommended a raised toilet seat. This does the job. The perfect solution is to have a plumber install a chair-height toilet. That's completely stable and eliminates any possible problems of a smaller hole. But that's not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: PaintmanjanTop Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Simple solution to a serious problem!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mother that is awaiting knee replacement surgery. I felt a little strange giving it to her but knew she was struggling getting up and out of chairs and she had mentioned hurting her shoulder trying to pull herself up with her bathroom sink. She called me practically crying tears of joy as this simple seat made her life so much easier. She asked me to order another one so she could keep one upstairs and downstairs. Second one arriving tomorrow and her shoulder is not hurting her anymore. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Busy7

customer_reviews.title: Post surgery lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the top 3 most important things I valued as I was completely non-weight bearing on one foot after surgery. I sincerely believe this device saved the knee on my good leg. I debated on whether to get the one with the handles, but I'm in decent shape. For the elderly or those with other conditions, the handles might be necessary. For me this was perfect. The opening is small, so I always take it off for #2. Gross, I know, but it's hard to clean when you're a foot down so it's something to think about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE DANGEROUS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.text: I was 2 weeks post-op from a total knee replacement. when I shifted my weight slightly to wipe, the aquasense toilet seat total shifted off the toilet and I fell off into the shower very hard. This is a law suit waiting to happen...my whole left side was bruised up, including my ribs. I thought I had broken a rib. It was difficult for two people to get me off the floor. DO NOT buy this piece of crap. It's dangerous!!The window for a refund was May 29th, so I couldn't get a refund. I was busy recuperating.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystine

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Had Total Knee Replacement and can honesty say this Seat Riser is almost as painful as Surgery itself! Very uncomfortable Hard Plastic! Get a Seat Riser That has some type of cushion or Soft plastic! This Riser has neither!
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put on or remove, very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Adds 4" to the toilet height for people after surgery or with the knee problems. Just put it on the toilet rim after getting regular toilet seat and lid lifted. No need to attach it, it is pretty stable with a little of caution exercised. It is as easy to lift and remove it (for example when you have guests). I have been using it for 3 years for the reasons listed above. Eventually it was no longer fresh looking on inside lower part so I bought the new one. Regular toilet seats need to be replaced after a few years as well, if someone cares about having bathrooms squeaky clean.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great to have after surgery.
customer_reviews.text: This extension is perfect! I had hip replacement surgery and needed this to give my standard height toilet more height. Just open both the lid and seat, place this extension on the bowl and that’s it. It fits snug to the bowl and is very solid. If you have a standard height toilet you really need this for the first couple weeks after hip surgery since your ability to bend is limited at first while healing.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Schuring

customer_reviews.title: Unable to secure, NOT safe!!
customer_reviews.text: No way to secure to the toilet. I’m a small person and was shocked at how easily it moved around. I was afraid every time I used it as it would pop out of place. Shocked they have not been sued.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls off toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: I recently had major surgery and needed this extended toilet top. Last night as I was rising from it, it slipped off the toilet and I fell:(. Had my daughter not heard me fall I would have laid on the floor until I was found. Today I am very sore. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Bee

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for knee surgery recovery
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for post-knee surgery. PERFECT. Easy to use, sits on the toilet bowl (doesn't attach), so you can easily move it toilet when someone else needs to use the bathroom. Just the right height. Has been a real godsend for the recovery period. I got one for downstairs bathroom as well as upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Ok but slides around
customer_reviews.text: This seat doesn't attach to your toilet but sits on the porcelain. There are two very small rubber patches on the bottom that are supposed to keep it from sliding around, but they should have it all the way around. I'm going to have to glue something to the seat to prevent it from moving. Otherwise it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: V. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: A Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Makes getting on & off of the toilet much easier. I'm recovering from hip replacement surgery. This is sturdy, easy to install, easy to use, easy to clean, & fits my small bathroom. I recommend measuring your toilet height & the height of a chair you find easy to get in & out of. Subtract the two & you'll be able to know what height you need for this type of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: DaJamster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean and perfect height
customer_reviews.text: Great height for my toilet and easy to put on and take off, very easy to clean, only downside for me is wish it was a bit softer when sitting on it as I had a total hip replacement which makes sitting on a little hard on the butt cheeks..... Very hard and durable plastic material..... Had to return it as it always moved from its position and making it a hazard to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Marco C.

customer_reviews.title: GRATEFUL TO HAVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Before I moved, I had purchased a higher toilet so that it was easier to get up and down with my bad back. I moved to an apartment I do not own; therefore I have to use the toilet they have. I bought this AquaSense Portable Raised Toilet Seat, White, 4 Inches and I love it! It is perfect. The height makes it very easy to get up and down, it fits securely to the bowl and I have no instability. Easy to remove and clean and put it back on.l HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Gallina

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Anything that serves you to enhance safety is likely a good thing and this hits the mark for enhancing safety. But.... My mother at 5' 6" tall found this to be about 1/2" or so too high. The matte finish further serves to enhance safety by providing just the right degree of grip but I found it to be difficult to clean - a real concern depending on who may be using it. Also, with no provision for a cover, it's certainly something of which Dr. Oz would not approve and the hollow design of this piece serves to amplify flush noises which can be an issue if you're dysphonic.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin CormackTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: After a TKR this seat extender is awesome. The seat fits securely on the porcelain portion of my toilet. The only thing its really firm and being that it fits inside the porcelain part of the toilet the opening its a bit small if your backside is on the large size. I am only 130 lbs and I thought its a bit snug, Being all I said, This extension was an saving grace and does the job for the price since I only needed it on a temporary basis.
customer_reviews.author: mycats3344

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for the girls - the real story
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I bought this ahead of time for a knee replacement. Getting and down is tough so this additional height is great - but - this had to have been designed by a woman. I'm an average size guy. It fits the toilet perfectly but the ring is so thick there's no slot in the front for a guy to do his business. I suppose if you were built with something the size of a straw and 8" long this would work, but an average guy is in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Choglidite

customer_reviews.title: Great value for short term use in family bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on this low-priced riser to use after hip replacement surgery. It’s a solidly built piece. No hand bars for lifting, but I have a wall bar and had my walker standing by. Seat has a “lip” but does not anchor to toilet, but that makes it easy for other people (even children) to lift it on and off. The riser does have some wiggle room On some shaped toilets, so sit down carefully, but I never felt unsafe. It did the job for my rehab phase.
customer_reviews.author: Addie James

customer_reviews.title: Great solution to an awkward problem.
customer_reviews.text: I had back surgery in recent years, and still have some issues. My toilets at home are high enough for me, but I often find that toilets at friend’s homes, or hotels, etc. HAVE VERY LOW TOILETS that are difficult for me to maneuver! This riser is mobile so I can take it with me for overnight and vacation ventures. It fits securely, yet easily removable. I carry my sanitizing wipes...and voila! Easy solution for a situation that was troublesome for me!
customer_reviews.author: DSheaBo

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one, folks! The best on the market.
customer_reviews.text: A great raised seat...better and cheaper than anything else out there. With this item, you merely sit it in place in front of your raised seat, leaving the existing toilet seat mounted where it is. Other raised seats slide about and require you to take your existing toilet seat off, then mount it to the top of their riser. It makes for an insecure, sliding mess that's hard to keep clean. THIS IS THE BEST! And easily removable for family members who don't require the extra height.
customer_reviews.author: Ron. Harris

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This 4 inch raised toilet seat is just what I needed. I don't have to make a "crash landing" onto the toilet now, I can sit down gently due to the raised height and my bad hip and knees. I only had to lift my toilet seat and put this on straight out of the box. Thank God I didn't need TOOLS!!! I would recommend this to anyone who simply needs a higher seat. Not for people who need railings, of course. Thank you. I may get another one for downstairs!
customer_reviews.author: Carolann Lightcap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: I'm tall (6 ft.), I'm old. My knees don't bend as well as they used to. I can't afford to install a new, taller toilet, so this riser seemed like it might be a good solution to my problem. I'm glad I decided to purchase it. It has solved my problem at an affordable price. Raising the toilet seat 4 inches made all the difference. Thanks, AquaSense!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Easiest ever! Adds 4” fits round bowl. Sturdy plastic
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I had a badly dislocated knee and couldn’t get up. The height of this really helps me to stand right up. I can also use it for a phys therapy exercise of sitting and standing ! This adds 4”. $ is right! My only complaint is the box! Big pictures of the toilet so all my friends at the USPS know ... what? Re- use the box for Xmas prezzies? Hahahahaha
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed!
customer_reviews.text: I had hip surgery this morning and so far this seat had made trips to the potty so much better! Its simple but gets the job done, and it feels secure. Update: I used this for 2 weeks post-op, it was great, I have no complaints! I'm now more mobile and don't need to use it, but I'm keeping it around because I have to have my other hip repaired at some point and I won't do it without this thing waiting for me at home!
customer_reviews.author: TrishaChristine

customer_reviews.title: Toilet help for bad hips
customer_reviews.text: If you ever need a hip replacement, this funny little aid will be a favorite. Your surgeon may warn you about sitting at a 90-degree angle or greater, and this raised seat will ensure you are more comfortable. Plus, it turns out installing a new, "higher" toilet only gains you 3 inches, so who needs that expense? You might not need this baby for long, but you'll be glad you have it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Best elevated seat around
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Just lift the lid and ring and it fits right over the bowl, providing about 3 inches of net height. Hard plastic design is a plus. Sturdy. I tried a soft raised seat, bad news all around. AquaSense is a must have for post hip replacement surgery, even anterior replacements, because squatting can be difficult due to stiffness and pain around the incision.
customer_reviews.author: Granfallooner

customer_reviews.title: Do buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver. I am six feet tall with knee problems because my last employer had me walking almost 10 miles a day (sometimes more) and wearing down shoes. My knees crack more and are opposed to me squatting or bending them in any way. Anyway, this product raised the seating so that I am comfortable and I truly am. Thank you. Now I wish that I could elevate everything in my apartment.
customer_reviews.author: zombielover

customer_reviews.title: Eased my pain
customer_reviews.text: I had my knee go out and this product made all the difference in the pain when having to use the bathroom. Although, I'm better now, I will definitely hold on to this...possible knee replacement surgery in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: This was too small for my toilet so I stuffed a towel in the back so it wouldn't move around much like other reviewers did. I got this to help with my hip surgery recovery but sitting on it hurt my hip much worse than the regular toilet height and seat. It was too hard, weirdly shaped and seemed the height was too tall for me and I'm 5'10" !
customer_reviews.author: julee r roper

customer_reviews.title: Portable hard plastic raised toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Was an easy fix to raise my toilet seat until I was able to install an ADA size toilet. Worth the money for those who don’t need the use of an ADA toilet but need a temporary higher seat. I have an oval shape toilet and it fit but you had to be careful when you first sit down. Works better with a round toilet better. But it still worked
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A MUST after hip replacement surgery
customer_reviews.text: Of all the gadgets I purchased to assist me with movement limitations after hip replacement surgery THIS was the most important. Slips right on the toilet bowl and made my life much less frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Lanz Groll

customer_reviews.title: Contoured for BETTER comfort than soft seats
customer_reviews.text: Don't be discouraged from getting this because it's not a "soft" seat. The top is contoured to provide a comfortable space for the "sit bones" & post-surgery hip bones. I was dreading giving up my soft toilet seat to gain the height needed for safer use after a total hip replacement, but this is actually MORE comfortable. Can't recommend it more highly!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Crane

customer_reviews.title: Not secure
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to use this it slipped off the toilet, I fell on the floor and my knee scooter jammed into my bathroom wall, leaving a huge black mark and dent. I had surgery on my ankle and am not permitted any weight bearing. I thought this device would make my bathroom usage a lot easier, but was mistaken. Don’ t buy this product! It is dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie J. Kopac

customer_reviews.title: Tall People Problems
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most people who need one of these for old age I simply needed something to boost the height of my roommate's toilets. Being tall it's difficult having to use the toilet and getting numb legs constantly. This device adequately fixed that issue for me. For the sake of keeping thing from falling into the toilet I keep it stored in the shower. This also makes cleaning it convenient as well so it's an all around great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany St Jordan

customer_reviews.title: HELPS RELIEVE STRESS ON YOUR BODY.............................
customer_reviews.text: Recently throwing my back out made it difficult, painful and strenuous to sit on my regular toilet seat without straining my back more. My friends who recently installed a new modern raised toilet seat in their newly remodeled bathroom, made me look on line for something that would help resolve my problem. Came across this amazing raised toilet seat that fits perfectly on my elongated toilet relieving me of any back strain, is comfortable and stays secure. I highly recommend to any one who is looking to avoid any type of strain on their body due to medical issues they are experiencing or just natural aging. This is the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer

customer_reviews.title: This works but needs a small tweak
customer_reviews.text: This works BUT it does slide around. I have an oblong toilet and it's ideally made for a rounded one. I fixed the sliding issue by putting NON SKID SHOWER STICKERS all around the underside of the ring. THIS SOLVED THE SLIDING ISSUE and it's now very stable and functional. This ring can be quickly stored out of sight. I really like that because I am only 51 and have accelerated arthritis due to a bone disease I had when I was a kid. Being able to put it away saves me from having to discuss it, etc. Privacy people!!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline M Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: I like it and it is quite sturdy. For the short time I needed it I never felt that it was going to slip out from under me when in use. There is a flange on the underside that fits inside the rim of the toilet and rubber swatches, for lack of a better term that helps keep it from slipping. The riser for the cost is an excellent value for the quality of the item. If you need a riser for long term I would think you couldn't do better value wise.
customer_reviews.author: T.

customer_reviews.title: Great for herniated disc and Sciatica!
customer_reviews.text: The height of this was so helpful when I herniated a disc in my lower back. I was really trying to limit twisting and turning and stretching. This was the perfect height and a great price. I ordered this while I was in the hospital, and it was sitting at my door when I arrived home. It fit perfectly with no slipping. I clean it easily with disinfectant wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Now we place this on an older style (round) toilet bowl as opposed to an oval shaped toilet bowl and it fits great. Due to the s
customer_reviews.text: In lieu of buying a new ADA toilet I opted to get a raised toilet seat. Now we place this on an older style (round) toilet bowl as opposed to an oval shaped toilet bowl and it fits great. Due to the shape of the raised toilet seat I don't think it would work well with an oval shaped bowl. But for us it has worked out great. It is comfortable and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best $20.00 I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my knees and legs due to tendinitis and having trouble getting up from toilet. This seat was a lifesaver. No more struggling to get up. I can just stand right up with no pain or struggle. I would recommend it. I clean it daily with Clorox wipes because it is plastic and holds odors. It will be the best $20.00 you spend.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Craft

customer_reviews.title: ... this for my Mom and we are both SO happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Mom and we are both SO happy with it. It is incredibly easy on and off - very stable and sturdy, and provides the extra height that was needed. Due to the extra height the opening seems a bit narrow and takes a little more effort sometime in the wiping arena - but well worth it for the benefits it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie L.

customer_reviews.title: Defective mounting raised toilet seat.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing product. Heavy solid plastic, durable but it doesn’t have that extendable flap to secure it in place like the description. Defective.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Perfect I had injured my ankle and needed a dozen stitches this was quite helpful allowing me to get on and off the toilet without any pressure on my ankles I also used one for my mom which was fabulous she was approaching 90 and could easily go to the toilet with. No assistance
customer_reviews.author: Logan's mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for Grandpa When He Visits.
customer_reviews.text: My 90 year old father in law is still going strong. But when he visits I hear his groans trying to sit on our low toilets. I bought this on a whim and just set it up for him in the bathroom he uses. Wow! Happy grandpa!!! Stays put. He is over six foot tall and it totally works!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Also great for heavier persons!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is just over 400lbs, and this thing has held up very nicely over the past few months! I took one star away because the interior has a ring (where the manufacturer melds the two pieces of plastic together) that makes the product less hygienic. Because of that, you have to be conscientious enough to carefully clean the grooved ring which is a bit annoying. Because it also stains somewhat easily...I'll probably just buy another sometime in near future. If mobility is an issue, this is a great device!
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful for my Elderly Mother
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my elderly mother when she began to have difficulty standing up in the bathroom. She now has grab bars installed on the walls on either side of the toilet, but is continuing to use this raised toilet seat because she finds it comfortable. She is about 5' 1" tall, and has had no problems with the height of the raised seat. An inexpensive item that has definitely improved her quality of life.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Graham

customer_reviews.title: Easy as pie to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy as pie to use. I bought it for travels and vacations at the beach. They never have handicap toilets. I have really enjoyed using this and so has my knee! Fits elongated tops just moves a little more. Set it to the back and it is stationary. Awesome life improvement!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy portable toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and did quite a bit of research before ordering this seat. One reviewer was quite concerned about the sturdiness of the seat because it not one solid piece of plastic. This should not be an issue as it is very sturdy. The person it was purchased for is a very heavy and there are no issues. It also has been used on at least three different shaped toilet seats without any problems. It is so lightweight it is taken along on along on outings in case there is not a raised toilet seat with hand railings. It's carried in a large bag and no one is the wiser. You can't beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: Books Galore

customer_reviews.title: Very Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Easier to clean than other models. Hard Plastic Durable, lasts years, Have had another one like it. Great for after surgeries, Knee, Abdominal,ETC. Older Women in general with Bladder trouble this is Awesome, as one needs to stand and bend forward to go pee to empty completely for relief, it's worth the money spent,
customer_reviews.author: Home Savvy

customer_reviews.title: fits securely, height is good
customer_reviews.text: have an installed one at home with handles, but keep this one at my daughters house for when im there. i miss the handles, but it fits very securely (the lip is a good two inches inside the bowl) so you can push off (getting old sucks, eh?)
customer_reviews.author: janae

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife had her left leg amputated and this helps tremendously for her to be more independent. Nothing to assemble which makes it nice for me as my hands are kind of full at present. It's almost too tall for her as she is 5'1" but has worked out well.
customer_reviews.author: Willee

customer_reviews.title: Potentially Very dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't have a locking mechanism and becomes unstable very easily. I failed to see this issue when I purchased it and almost injured my operated hip. Manufacturer / seller Should make warn potential buyers of this failure in design. AD
customer_reviews.author: ad

customer_reviews.title: I am not so happy about this product
customer_reviews.text: I am not so happy about this product. Despite no-skid patches, it moves slightly when shifting one’s weight. The opening is so small that it’s easy to get “wet” when using to void. Finally, in spite of the ease of putting it on and off the toilet, it really would benefit by having some type of handle, from a hygiene perspective.
customer_reviews.author: MaryES

customer_reviews.title: Good quality riser seat for low toilets.  Very good for accessibility and people with mobility problems.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my father to use on an elongated toilet. It works although my mother had to roll and wedge an old towel/rag between this riser and the back cover to keep it from moving. That said, it's a high quality seat in my father's opinion. He has a much easier time getting off the pot with this. I haven't gotten a report on cleaning it but so far it only gets thumbs up from my parents. He did request a 3 inch riser after using this. His feet would hang a bit off the floor, making it a little more uncomfortable to sit. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: CookieMonster

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for height, this is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: I had to return mine only because of the safety feature on the bottom did not fit inside the seat like it should to hold it in place. It's not the manufacturers fault, it's just that my toilet is one of those water conserving small small toilet.
customer_reviews.author: BearSpirit

customer_reviews.title: Fixes a serious issue for $16
customer_reviews.text: Older relative visiting can't get up from the john without assistance. Drop this on, wiggles around a bit but as soon as pressure put on it the gasket sticks to the porcelain and it feels solid. Pops on and off as needed, does the job without draining the wallet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Fram

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. There is a little wiggle to it on my toilet, but feels secure when you sit on it. It is very easy to clean and very easy to remove for cleaning. Bought for elderly mother's benefit and she is well pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have weak knees so it's hard to get up off low chairs or even a worse problem are toilet seats. I needed to stay in a hotel for a week recently and feared the toilet would be an issue. I bought this product and discreetly hid it in a gym bag as to not walk into a fancy hotel lobby with a toilet seat under my arm. It fit perfectly and was just what I needed to get on and off the hotel toilet which was low as expected. Now I won't travel overnight without it. One less thing to worry about. I highly recommend it. It's very light and easy to manage in a carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid item. We have an elongated bowl so it slid back first time. So now I know. Ordered it when I had a sore knee. My knee healed quickly but will keep this raised seat handy. Comes in product box so no privacy-lol!
customer_reviews.author: CathyGrace

customer_reviews.title: Makes all the difference
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use while currently recovering from ankle surgery and being non-weight bearing on one foot/leg. The I use toilet is old and low to the ground, so the 4 inches on this makes a huge difference in my situation. It is also very stable and comfortable despite being made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Anvil

customer_reviews.title: easier sit down and get up for challenged user
customer_reviews.text: Having recently had an operation that temporarily totally disabled one leg, this raised seat has made my life somewhat easier. It sits atop my rounder (not extended oval) seat with a sleeve that projects slightly downward through the regular seat to hold it in place. It is easy to put in and remove. Like anything else used for this it will require regular cleaning. I now can manage without a grab bar to easily use our home facilities. For its reasonable price, it is a worthwhile purchase for anyone with a similar problem.
customer_reviews.author: canonwren

customer_reviews.title: You dont know how low your toilet is till you use this
customer_reviews.text: Had to have a hip replaced incurring restrictions on how far could bend legs. You'll never realise how low your toilet truly is until you can't move about properly. Super quick shipping a plus cause you'll be ready to use it when it arrives. Only downside is the added height makes for equal water displacement splashes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding- no installation required. 86 year old Mom gives rave reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mom. Required no installation. Just raise the seat cover and press it down over the bowl. Very secure and sturdy. This one item has made my 86 year old Mom much more confident and steady when having to get up multiple times in the night to use the restroom. Thank you for making such a common sense- easy to use- item for those requiring a raised seat.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Roby

customer_reviews.title: Wish I got this one before I got the other one.
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect on my standard size toilet . Sits perfectly and firmly on the toilet . Easy removal for cleaning. Height is perfect to get up and down. Every use keeps all of your visits going straight into the bowl .
customer_reviews.author: brad b

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good price point.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Very sturdy. Not for elongated toilet, but fine for round. It has a plastic piece on bottom side that fits into toilet so it does not move around. Did not disconnect the seat just pulled it up so this fits pretty snug. Four inches is pretty high but I could not find one in the 2-3 inch range. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: Janet W

customer_reviews.title: It's a great seat but the plastic does crack
customer_reviews.text: This was my third seat in about three years I have no problem replacing it however this new one has little pricks in the plastic seat like my old one got but this is brand new one . Would return but cant seem to repackage.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne estrada

customer_reviews.title: This item is unsafe.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic piece at the bottom of the seat is very thin and weak and I do not think it would safely keep the seat from easily slipping off the toliet. I returned this item, as I felt it is unsafe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Just Sue

customer_reviews.title: If you need one, this one is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at other sellers and different manufactures with some selling for twice as much, but decided on this one because of the good reviews. For $20 it was a good buy for something only needed for short term use after a hip replacement. With a toilet safety rail it makes it a lot easier to get up.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for people with knee troubles
customer_reviews.text: I was needing help getting off the commode because of the pressure trying to get up. This eliminated that completely. I now don't need an audience when getting up (or sitting down). Dignity restored!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Knee replacement. This is perfect and inexpensive. Lifted the seat from the toilet and put this in- one second installation. Made the toilet seat nice and high. No handles, so you have to be able to get up and down by yourself. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: chica

customer_reviews.title: This is the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who has had knee surgery or hip surgery, this is the best and at such a reasonable price. What a difference it makes in eliminating pain. The quality is fine, durable and was very prompt with delivery...
customer_reviews.author: Mary Olender

customer_reviews.title: it does what i need and that's raise my botton high enough to keep my testicles out of the bowl.
customer_reviews.text: it's too high for what i need and that is to raise my bottom high to keep my testicles out of the bowl, i should have gotten the two inch high riser. i keep thinking about ordering the two inch model, but since my balls are dry the urgency is gone.
customer_reviews.author: markhas

customer_reviews.title: So wonderful after hip/knee/ foot surgery!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I purchased this after surgery and it was so helpful for me with limited mobility. Easy to clean, easy to use - no tools or adjustments to your toilet. Came in a sturdy box with handle for me to store away when I no longer need it. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: I do wish it was about 1/2" - 1" taller as it would be perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Although this seat is about 1/2" lower than a previous one, it is helpful but not nearly as much as the higher one. I do wish it was about 1/2" - 1" taller as it would be perfect for me. Would not reorder if I could find one like I had. Still it will help most people I would think.
customer_reviews.author: B. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and low price!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and fit round bowl well. It was sturdy and didn’t slip. I tried it out before my mom sat on it by jumping and moving in it a lot to make sure it was really sturdy and I felt safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Stable, easy to remove and to place. I don't know what we would do without it when visiting our daughter. The only downside is that it does need to be frequently cleaned; don't know why, but it does need more attention than the toilet. Small price to pay for comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Etherege

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my elderly mother that is awaiting hip replacement. It was hard for her to get down on the standard toilet and even harder for her to get up. Gave it to her today! She is very happy!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Reid West

customer_reviews.title: Great price. I looked at several in the $60 ...
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for someone recovering from surgery. Great price. I looked at several in the $60 range. This one at $20 is nicely made, fits a small standard toilet with the seat up. A nearly 2" extension down past the inside rim of the porcelain holds it in place simply and stably. Took it out of the box, put it on the toilet, done.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Okay...
customer_reviews.text: It's okay for a toilet seat riser. A little wobbly as it sits on the toilet. I have another one that locks into place and feels much sturdier (no movement while in place.) So, this is okay, but could be a tighter fit. (I will acknowledge that not every toilet seat is identical in inside dimensions so maybe double check size when ordering.)
customer_reviews.author: joanies

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I injured my knee and had to wear an immobilizer making it a bit hard to get up off of the toilet. This added enough height that I could easily get on and off without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: WendyA

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful item after knee replacement
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful item after knee replacement. I had considered purchasing one of the more expensive raised toilet seats ($100 or more) that come with handles/bars on the sides to provide leverage in getting up. However, I just put my walker in front of the toilet when using it and that provides all the leverage I need. So glad I purchased this seat-----a wonderful item and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Menunya

customer_reviews.title: Post knee surgery relief
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my grandmother after she had her knee surgery. She liked it so much, we bought her another one! She keeps one at her daughters house and one at her house. Whenever she has company, she just simply takes it off. It’s lightweight and fits on pretty much any toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Thompson

customer_reviews.title: I was especially pleased that it requires no tools
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous solution if you need a higher toilet seat temporarily. I bought it in anticipation of surgery, and it made sitting and rising much easier. I was especially pleased that it requires no tools, yet it is incredibly secure. My guests have not minded using it, but it could be removed easily (and replaced) if they did. I am ordering a second one for another bathroom so that I can have one on both levels of my home. Cleaning is also very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Woodman

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Since No Tools Required
customer_reviews.text: This is very convenient since you don’t have to screw it down. Since I had to have bilateral hip arthroscopies, I also purchased hand rails to help me feel more stable. I felt sturdy and safe while sitting on the raised toilet seat, but recommend hand rails for those who are more unsteady as it can slide a little.
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: slips under you!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is dangerous because it slips out from under you while you are trying to use it - bought for a disabled relative to use while traveling, wasn't safe.
customer_reviews.author: Charity June

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with this product and so convenient getting it in the mail two days after ordering. Had a hip replacement and recommended by my surgeon.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: This is much better than the seats you have to removed the toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than the seats you have to removed the toilet seat and then screw the raised seat into the toilet because it just fits right over the bowl. When I have company I can just set it in the bathtub so they can have the regular toilet seat to use. I love that!
customer_reviews.author: J. Barker

customer_reviews.title: However it felt very sturdy even with my 350 pounds as long as I ...
customer_reviews.text: With back and knee problems, I cannot get up from a low toilet. This is the answer. It raises the toilet seat to a point I can get up from. It fit on an oblong potty with the seat up. It would not fit with the seat down. I had a little problem with it wanting to slip. However it felt very sturdy even with my 350 pounds as long as I did not lean over to pick something off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Bevs Mom

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit for elongated bowls.
customer_reviews.text: The product is made well and appears sturdy; however, it did not fit our elongated toilet bowl snugly. I had to fabricate a shim from a pool noodle and place it at the back of the seat to make it fit tight on the the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: John Sliman

customer_reviews.title: When you can't sit as well as your used to, and you have business to do, this helps immensely.
customer_reviews.text: Hard to think I'd love a raised toilet seat but I did. Luckily I only needed it a short time until my intractable sciatica resolved. When you can't bend enough to sit, you're in a not-so-good place. The extra 4" allowed me to do what needed to be done. It "locked" in place with the toilet seat that I had already. I hope I never have to use it again. Ha!
customer_reviews.author: Stef603

customer_reviews.title: Worked when needed
customer_reviews.text: Had a hip joint replacement operation. Needed a higher toilet seat because I could not bend my hip to sit on a lower regular seat. Served its purpose. Worked well without having to replace the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and as advertised. Good price. Very durable product. Fits the toilet well. My wife had knee surgery on both knees at the same time. This product really helped during the healing process. I replaced one of the toilets with a higher toilet and we used this on the other toilet. I would've been better off just buying two of these.
customer_reviews.author: Ann S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nearly perfect, but the hole is a little too small, and it wiggles from side to side on the toilet. However, works as it needs to and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Zarrin reynolds

product_meta.title: AquaSense Portable Raised Toilet Seat, White, 4 Inches
product_meta.description:
Raised Toilet Seats by AquaSense elevate the toilet higher than a regular toilet seat. This economical, white, 4 inch elevated toilet seat makes it easier to get on and off the toilet and features a seamless, easy to clean, polyethylene construction. This raised toilet seat is lightweight, portable and sized to fit most standard commode bowls. The AquaSense 4 inch Elevated Toilet Seat has a 400 lb (181 kg) maximum weight capacity. Model # 770 610


Specifications

 * Weight Capacity: 400 lbs.
 * Item Weight: 1.5 lbs.
 * Seat Width: 15.0"
 * Seat Depth: 15.0"
 * Assembled Dimensions (open): 15.0" x 15.0" x 4.0"
feature_bullets: This raised toilet seat elevates the toilet 4 inches higher than a regular toilet seat
Makes it easier to get on and off the toilet and features a seamless, easy to clean, polyethylene construction
AquaSense Raised Toilet Seats are lightweight and portable
Sized to fit most standard commode bowls. Does not fit elongated toilets

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
